Infectious disease is a **death cause category**. It means that it is a collection of **death causes** and so we can compute the probability of dying from this death cause category by adding up all of its death causes. 

#### Alternative names:
* Inf. disease
* Infectious disease
* InfectiousDisease

#### Death causes

Infectious disease consists of the following causes

* [Flu](/model/Flu)
* [Hepatitis](/model/Hepatitis)
* [HIV](/model/HIV)
* [Malaria](/model/Malaria)
* [Menigitis](/model/Menigitis)
* [Pneumonia](/model/Pneumonia)
* [Salmonella](/model/Salmonella)
* [Syphilis](/model/Syphilis)
* [Tubercolosis](/model/Tubercolosis)
* [Whooping cough](/model/Whooping_Cough)

#### Categories

Infectious disease is itself part of the following death cause categories

* [Non-violent death](/model/NonViolentDeath)

#### Risk factors

Infectious disease has no [risk factors](/model/intro#risk-factor) in the model (yet).
